00080 const char *Micropolis::getMicropolisVersion()
00081 {
00082     return MICROPOLIS_VERSION;

00092 static bool testDirectory(const std::string& dir, const char *envVar)
00093 {
00094     struct stat statbuf;
00095 
00096     if (stat(dir.c_str(), &statbuf) == 0 && S_ISDIR(statbuf.st_mode)) {
00097 
00098         return true;
00099     }
00100 
00101     fprintf(stderr, "Can't find the directory \"%s\"!\n", dir.c_str());
00102     fprintf(stderr,
00103             "The environment variable \"%s\" should name a directory.\n",
00104             envVar);
00105 
00106     return false;
00107 }
00108 
00110 void Micropolis::environmentInit()
00111 {
00112     const char *s = getenv("SIMHOME");
00113     if (s == NULL) {
00114         s = ".";
00115     }
00116     homeDir = s;
00117 
00118     if (testDirectory(homeDir, "$SIMHOME")) {
00119 
00120         resourceDir = homeDir + "/res/";
00121         if (testDirectory(resourceDir, "$SIMHOME/res")) {
00122 
00123             return; // All ok
00124         }
00125     }
00126 
00127     // Failed on $SIMHOME, ".", or the 'res' directory.
00128     fprintf(stderr,
00129             "Please check the environment or reinstall Micropolis and try again! Sorry!\n");
00130     exit(1);
00131 }

00135 void Micropolis::simInit()
00136 {
00137     setEnableSound(true); // Enable sound
00138     mustUpdateOptions = true; // Update options displayed at user
00139     scenario = SC_NONE;
00140     startingYear = 1900;
00141     simPasses = 1;
00142     simPass = 0;
00143     setAutoGoto(true); // Enable auto-goto
00144     setCityTax(7);
00145     cityTime = 50;
00146     setEnableDisasters(true); // Enable disasters
00147     setAutoBulldoze(true); // Enable auto bulldoze
00148     setAutoBudget(true); // Enable auto-budget
00149     blinkFlag = 1;
00150     simSpeed = 3;
00151     changeEval();
00152     simPaused = false; // Simulation is running
00153     simLoops = 0;
00154     initSimLoad = 2;
00155 
00156     initMapArrays();
00157     initGraphs();
00158     initFundingLevel();
00159     resetMapState();
00160     resetEditorState();
00161     clearMap();
00162     initWillStuff();
00163     setFunds(5000);
00164     setGameLevelFunds(LEVEL_EASY);
00165     setSpeed(0);
00166     setPasses(1);
00167 }

00175 void Micropolis::simUpdate()
00176 {
00177     //printf("simUpdate\n");
00178     blinkFlag = ((tickCount() % 60) < 30) ? 1 : -1;
00179 
00180     if (simSpeed && !heatSteps) {
00181       tilesAnimated = false;
00182     }
00183 
00184     doUpdateHeads();
00185     graphDoer();
00186     updateBudget();
00187     scoreDoer();
00188 }

00190 
00198 void Micropolis::simHeat()
00199 {
00200     int x, y;
00201     static int a = 0;
00202     short *src, *dst;
00203     int fl = heatFlow;
00204 
00205     const int SRCCOL = WORLD_H + 2;
00206     const int DSTCOL = WORLD_H;
00207 
00208 
00209     if (cellSrc == NULL) {
00210         cellSrc = (short *)newPtr((WORLD_W + 2) * (WORLD_H + 2) * sizeof (short));
00211         cellDst = (short *)&map[0][0];
00212     }
00213 
00214     src = cellSrc + SRCCOL + 1;
00215     dst = cellDst;
00216 
00217     /*
00218      * Copy wrapping edges:
00219      *
00220      *  0   ff  f0 f1 ... fe ff     f0
00221      *
00222      *  1   0f  00 01 ... 0e 0f     00
00223      *  2   1f  10 11 ... 1e 1f     10
00224      *      ..  .. ..     .. ..     ..
00225      *      ef  e0 e1 ... ee ef     e0
00226      *  h   ff  f0 f1 ... fe ff     f0
00227      *
00228      *  h+1 0f  00 01 ... 0e 0f     00
00229      *
00230      * wrap value:  effect:
00231      *  0   no effect
00232      *  1   copy future=>past, no wrap
00233      *  2   no copy, wrap edges
00234      *  3   copy future=>past, wrap edges
00235      *  4   copy future=>past, same edges
00236      */
00237 
00238     switch (heatWrap) {
00239         case 0:
00240             break;
00241         case 1:
00242             for (x = 0; x < WORLD_W; x++) {
00243                 memcpy(src, dst, WORLD_H * sizeof (short));
00244                 src += SRCCOL;
00245                 dst += DSTCOL;
00246             }
00247             break;
00248         case 2:
00249             for (x = 0; x < WORLD_W; x++) {
00250                 src[-1] = src[WORLD_H - 1];
00251                 src[WORLD_H] = src[0];
00252                 src += SRCCOL;
00253                 dst += DSTCOL;
00254             }
00255             memcpy(
00256                 cellSrc,
00257                 cellSrc + (SRCCOL * WORLD_W),
00258                 SRCCOL * sizeof (short));
00259             memcpy(
00260                 cellSrc + SRCCOL * (WORLD_W + 1),
00261                 cellSrc + SRCCOL,
00262                 SRCCOL * sizeof (short));
00263             break;
00264         case 3:
00265             for (x = 0; x < WORLD_W; x++) {
00266                 memcpy(src, dst, WORLD_H * sizeof (short));
00267                 src[-1] = src[WORLD_H - 1];
00268                 src[WORLD_H] = src[0];
00269                 src += SRCCOL;
00270                 dst += DSTCOL;
00271             }
00272             memcpy(
00273                 cellSrc,
00274                 cellSrc + (SRCCOL * WORLD_W),
00275                 SRCCOL * sizeof (short));
00276             memcpy(
00277                 cellSrc + SRCCOL * (WORLD_W + 1),
00278                 cellSrc + SRCCOL,
00279                 SRCCOL * sizeof (short));
00280             break;
00281         case 4:
00282             src[0] =
00283                 dst[0];
00284             src[1 + WORLD_H] =
00285                 dst[WORLD_H - 1];
00286             src[(1 + WORLD_W) * SRCCOL] =
00287                 dst[(WORLD_W - 1) * DSTCOL];
00288             src[((2 + WORLD_W) * SRCCOL) - 1] =
00289                 dst[(WORLD_W * WORLD_H) - 1];
00290             for (x = 0; x < WORLD_W; x++) {
00291                 memcpy(src, dst, WORLD_H * sizeof (short));
00292                 src[-1] = src[0];
00293                 src[WORLD_H] =  src[WORLD_H - 1];
00294                 src += SRCCOL;
00295                 dst += DSTCOL;
00296             }
00297             memcpy(
00298                 cellSrc + (SRCCOL * (WORLD_W + 1)),
00299                 cellSrc + (SRCCOL * WORLD_W),
00300                 SRCCOL * sizeof (short));
00301             memcpy(
00302                 cellSrc,
00303                 cellSrc + SRCCOL,
00304                 SRCCOL * sizeof (short));
00305             break;
00306         default:
00307             NOT_REACHED();
00308             break;
00309     }
00310 
00311 
00312 #define CLIPPER_LOOP_BODY(CODE) \
00313     src = cellSrc; dst = cellDst; \
00314     for (x = 0; x < WORLD_W;) { \
00315         short nw, n, ne, w, c, e, sw, s, se; \
00316         src = cellSrc + (x * SRCCOL); \
00317         dst = cellDst + (x * DSTCOL); \
00318         w = src[0]; c = src[SRCCOL]; e = src[2 * SRCCOL]; \
00319         sw = src[1]; s = src[SRCCOL + 1]; se = src[(2 * SRCCOL) + 1]; \
00320         for (y = 0; y < WORLD_H; y++) { \
00321             nw = w; w = sw; sw = src[2]; \
00322             n = c; c = s; s = src[SRCCOL + 2]; \
00323             ne = e; e = se; se = src[(2 * SRCCOL) + 2]; \
00324             { CODE } \
00325             src++; dst++; \
00326         } \
00327         x++; \
00328         src = cellSrc + ((x + 1) * SRCCOL) - 3; \
00329         dst = cellDst + ((x + 1) * DSTCOL) - 1; \
00330         nw = src[1]; n = src[SRCCOL + 1]; ne = src[(2 * SRCCOL) + 1]; \
00331         w = src[2]; c = src[SRCCOL + 2]; e = src[(2 * SRCCOL) + 2]; \
00332         for (y = WORLD_H - 1; y >= 0; y--) { \
00333             sw = w; w = nw; nw = src[0]; \
00334             s = c; c = n; n = src[SRCCOL]; \
00335             se = e; e = ne; ne = src[2 * SRCCOL]; \
00336             { CODE } \
00337             src--; dst--; \
00338         } \
00339         x++; \
00340     }
00341 
00342 
00343     switch (heatRule) {
00344 
00345       case 0:
00346 
00347 #define HEAT \
00348     a += nw + n + ne + w + e + sw + s + se + fl; \
00349     dst[0] = ((a >> 3) & LOMASK) | ANIMBIT | BURNBIT | BULLBIT; \
00350     a &= 7;
00351 
00352         CLIPPER_LOOP_BODY(HEAT);
00353         break;
00354 
00355       case 1:
00356 
00357 #define ECOMASK 0x3fc
00358 #define ECO \
00359     { \
00360         c -= fl; n -= fl; s -= fl; e -= fl; w -= fl; \
00361         ne -= fl; nw -= fl; se -= fl; sw -= fl; \
00362         /* anneal */ \
00363         int sum = \
00364             (c&1) + (n&1) + (s&1) + (e&1) + (w&1) + \
00365             (ne&1) + (nw&1) + (se&1) + (sw&1), cell; \
00366         if (((sum > 5) || (sum == 4))) { \
00367             /* brian's brain */ \
00368             cell = \
00369                 ((c <<1) & (0x3fc)) | \
00370                 (((((c >>1)&3) == 0) && \
00371                   (((n&2) + (s&2) + (e&2) + (w&2) + \
00372                     (ne&2) + (nw&2) + (se&2) + (sw&2)) == (2 <<1))      \
00373                  ) ? 2 : 0) | \
00374                  1; \
00375         } else { \
00376             /* anti-life */ \
00377             sum = \
00378                 ((n&2) + (s&2) + (e&2) + (w&2) + \
00379                  (ne&2) + (nw&2) + (se&2) + (sw&2)) >>1; \
00380             cell = \
00381                 (((c ^ 2) <<1) & ECOMASK) | \
00382                 ((c&2) \
00383                    ? ((sum != 5) ? 2 : 0) \
00384                    : (((sum != 5) && (sum != 6)) ? 2 : 0)); \
00385         } \
00386         dst[0] = \
00387             ((fl + cell) & LOMASK) | ANIMBIT | BURNBIT | BULLBIT; \
00388         c += fl; n += fl; s += fl; e += fl; w += fl; \
00389         ne += fl; nw += fl; se += fl; sw += fl; \
00390     }
00391 
00392         CLIPPER_LOOP_BODY(ECO);
00393 
00394         break;
00395 
00396         default:
00397             NOT_REACHED();
00398             break;
00399     }
00400 }
00401 
00402 
00403 void Micropolis::simLoop(bool doSim)
00404 {
00405    if (heatSteps) {
00406        int j;
00407 
00408        for (j = 0; j < heatSteps; j++) {
00409            simHeat();
00410        }
00411 
00412        moveObjects();
00413        simRobots();
00414 
00415        newMap = 1;
00416 
00417    } else {
00418        if (doSim) {
00419            simFrame();
00420        }
00421 
00422        moveObjects();
00423        simRobots();
00424    }
00425 
00426    simLoops++;
00427 }
00428 
00429 
00435 void Micropolis::simTick()
00436 {
00437     if (simSpeed) {
00438         for (simPass = 0; simPass < simPasses; simPass++) {
00439             simLoop(true);
00440         }
00441     }
00442     simUpdate();
00443 }

00446 void Micropolis::simRobots()
00447 {
00448     callback("simRobots", "");
00449 }
